relation: Never used by this routine and always available
Initially reserved; available after being freed by LIB$FREE_EF
textBeforeTable: The values of error-source and their meanings are as follows: error-source argument is the address of a longword containing the error source. Integer code indicating where the error was found. The by reference mechanism: read only access: longword integer (signed) type: longword_signed OpenVMS usage: error-sourcerms-stv argument is the address of an unsigned longword that contains this secondary condition code. Secondary condition code (FAB$L_STV) which describes the error that occurred. The by reference mechanism: read only access: longword (unsigned) type: cond_value OpenVMS usage: rms-stvrms-sts argument is the address of an unsigned longword that contains this primary condition code. Primary condition code (FAB$L_STS) which describes the error that occurred. The by reference mechanism: read only access: longword (unsigned) type: cond_value OpenVMS usage: rms-stsnew-resultant-name was specified, it is used to pass the string to the error routine. Otherwise, a class S, type T string is passed. Any string class is supported. RMS resultant file specification of the new file name being used when the error occurred. If by descriptor mechanism: read only access: character string type: char_string OpenVMS
textAfterTable: type: longword (unsigned) access: read only mechanism: unspecified Value of user-specified-argument that LIB$RENAME_FILE passes to the error routine using the same passing mechanism that was used to pass it to LIB$RENAME_FILE. If the error routine returns a success status (bit 0 set), then LIB$RENAME_FILE will continue processing files. If the error routine returns a failure status (bit 0 clear), processing ceases immediately and LIB$RENAME_FILE returns with an error status. If the user-error-procedure argument is not specified, LIB$RENAME_FILE will return to its caller the most severe error status encountered while renaming the files. If the error routine is called for an error, the success status LIB$_ERRROUCAL is returned. The error routine is not called for errors related to string copying. Call Format for a Confirm Routine The calling format of a confirm routine is as follows: user-confirm-procedure old-filespec ,new-filespec ,old-fab [,user-specified-argument] old-filespec OpenVMS usage: char_string type: character string access: read only mechanism: by descriptor RMS resultant file specification of the file about to be renamed. If old-resultant-name was specified, it is used to pass the string to the confirm routine. Otherwise, a class S, type T
